sentence.Network_en: Woollen cloth and timber were sent to Egypt in exchange for linen or papyrus.
sentence.Network_cn: 羊毛料和木材送到埃及以换取亚麻布或纸莎草纸.

sentence.Network_en: Since papyrus dries up and crumble, very few documents of ancient Egypt have survived.
sentence.Network_cn: 因草片会干裂成粉末所以古埃及的文件很少保存下来.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 纸草（PAPYRUS）是大自然赐给古埃及人的宝物是一种多年生的绿色长杆草本，在尼罗河三角洲的沼泽中自生自灭。古埃及利用这种 …
纸莎草纸是由一种叫做纸莎草(papyrus)的植物制成的纸张.其实纸莎草的功能不仅造纸,还可制成篮子.衣袜.绳子.甚至能够造船!最迟在 …
莎草纸：虽然不是纸，而是用一种尼罗河芦苇做的，这种书在希腊语中叫莎草纸（Papyrus）。我们的“纸”这个词（Paper）就是这样 …
称为纸莎草纸（Papyrus）古埃及人用天然植物颜料在其上写字或着色。莎草纸的质感很天然，浓浓的古代味道。

园林在线 - 植物库 ... Colocasia tonoimo Nakai 芋属 Cyperus papyrus 莎草属 Hydrocotyle vulgaris 天胡荽属.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in sense 2): via Latin from Greek papuros. Sense 1 dates from the early 18th cent

entry.def: Papyrus is  a tall water plant that grows in Africa.

entry.tran: （古代埃及、罗马和希腊用的）纸莎草纸
entry.def: Papyrus is a type of paper made from papyrus stems that was used in ancient Egypt, Rome, and Greece.

entry.tran: （写在纸莎草纸上的）古代文献
entry.def: A papyrus is an ancient document that is written on papyrus.

means.word_mean: 1. paper made from the papyrus plant by cutting it in strips and pressing it flat; used by ancient Egyptians and Greeks and Romans
2. tall sedge of the Nile valley yielding fiber that served many purposes in historic times

auth_sentence.content: The oldest preserved descriptions of snakes can be found in the Brooklyn Papyrus.
